Description: Collaborative approaches that leverage multimodal RWD and three-dimensional tumor modeling to link molecular profiles to therapeutic response can be broadly applied to preclinical and post-market strategies, including hypothesis generation, target validation, signature development, combination therapy optimization, and label expansion. 3D assays combine the precision of next generation sequencing with the capabilities of AI enabled confocal microscopy, allowing investigators to better understand the relationships between tumor molecular alterations and response to targeted therapies such as small molecules, oncolytic viruses, neoantigen targeting TCRs, immune cell engaging bispecifics and engineered CARs.
SearchResultBody: ESP28. Tempus: Real world data and tumor modeling for discovery and translational research: refining and validating hypotheses through targeted research applications
Title: Tempus: Real world data and tumor modeling for discovery and translational research: refining and validating hypotheses through targeted research applications
